intro: Patis racemosa, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces milky sap, which is a common feature among species in the Euphorbiaceae family. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Patis racemosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
